The United Nations High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR), estimated that from 1993 to 2012, over 17,000 people lost their lives attempting to travel across the sea from Africa to Southern European states.

By James Bithell

A recent study by the OECD showed that 16-24 year olds in England are among the least skilled in terms of literacy and numeracy in the industrialised world.

Educating Britain

Tristam Hunt, Labour shadow education secretary, recently appeared on the Andrew Marr show claiming that he, and Ed Miliband, would back parent-run free-schools if they were successful at the next election.

Accusations of discrimination have been thrown at the International Criminal Court in recent days due to its focus on investigating African cases, which is seen by many as unfair.

Sarah Vowden discusses the future for Ugandan's democracy. With human rights violations still a regular occurrence under Museveni, should the world take action?

As figures show 9 out of 10 people walk free from their first violent crime Will Aske questions what this means for the justice system.
